Slides.caption: Our farm activities extend not only to catering for our healthy animals. But we also advise and help other local farmers on zero grazing and other productive farming practices.
With most emphasis on Dairy, We also carry out fish farming, plantation and more which in return help us for food security, income and feeding our animals

About.paragraph: Buyanga dairy farm is designed to boost agriculture, majoring in Dairy and poultry  in order to increase the incomes of small scale farmers, so they can lift their families and communities out of poverty.
About.vision: Atleast in the middle or by the end of the decade we'll have grown our farm from 17 to a warping 200 animals. And have managed to help a number of local farmers so the chain of development is kept steady
About.mission: Our ambition is to fight poverty through building and growing productive farming systems for ourselves and the local farmers in our area. We guide them on how to breed healthy animals.

Services.name: Dairy farming and food security
Services.text: We keep our animals(cows) purposely to generate income and for diary products like beef, milk, butter, cheese etc! And from 2 cows we've managed to keep around 15 more animals

Services.name: Advisory and inspiration
Services.text: We push knowledge down to the local farmers nearby on effective farming practices through organizing and attending seminars, Organizing the farmers into groups to grow together

Services.name: Guiding local farmers on breeds
Services.text: With close attention offered through guiding them, to we also help our local farmers deeply technical practices like articifial insermination, breeding their animals, keeping records(how many liters of milk the cows produce and more)

Services.name: Finding market for farmer's products
Services.text: Since it's all about income. We've helped farmers on finding better market for their produce. Where they can sell their milk

Services.name: Small scale gardens
Services.text: On the side, we also grow crops, we practice and encourage modern practices like small scale vertical gardens of skuma wiki, we have a large banana plantations and make use of the cow dung from the animals to as pesticides and fertilizers

Services.name: Aquaculture
Services.text: we have ponds of fish and aim to encourage farmers on aqua culture too

Blog.title: We are inspired more - Ugandas Dairy farmers develop taste for new market
Blog.article: Keeping cattle is a time-honored cultural tradition in western Uganda, where the iconic long-horned animals are associated with royalty—and valued for far more than the milk they produce. But as families shift to commercial farming to meet the nation’s steadily rising demand for milk, many of them need advice on techniques that will help fortify milk production. Joseph Nsereko, a farmer in Mbarara, used to be one of those farmers looking for support. He struggled to increase milk production to beyond 180 liters per day from a dairy herd of around 30 cows. Pearl Dairy, a milk processor that depends on local farmers for a sustainable, steady supply of milk, reached out to train Nsereko. With Pearl Dairy’s guidance—including direct engagement and access to regular agricultural extension services—he doubled his farm’s daily raw milk output

Blog.title: Uganda's ever growing diary sector. This inspires us so much
Blog.article: It was first estimated that livestock contributed 1.7 percent to total national GDP in 2009. That estimate was later revised to about 3.2 percent. By 2014, that contribution had risen to 9 percent of national GDP. The cattle kept are predominantly indigenous breeds, accustomed to the weather and husbandry practices as practiced by the herder communities, conditions that many exotic breeds could not withstand. Exotic breeds have been introduced, but the majority of farms have mixed breeds, whose productivity, although higher than the traditional breeds, does not match that of the exotics.
